thread.title: New Canaan harriers run third at Wickham Invitational
thread.title_full: New Canaan harriers run third at Wickham Invitational

author: Dave Stewart
title: New Canaan harriers run third at Wickham Invitational
text:
By Dave Stewart on October 12, 2015 in FCIAC , High School Sports , Sports , Sports Lead · 0 Comments 
The New Canaan Rams boys cross country team tuned up for the postseason, and got a taste of the state tournament course, as they raced in the Wickham Park Invitational in Manchester on Saturday. 
With more than 20 runners in action, the Rams fared well, finishing third in the unseeded varsity race, and fourth in one of two junior varsity races. 
Junior Michael St. George continued to be the pace-setter for New Canaan, taking 12th place in the varsity race. St. George finished the 5K race in 17:27. 
Sophomore Alex Urbahn was not far behind, crossing the finish line in 17:37 to take 24th place overall. 
Wickham Park, known for its many hills and up-and-down sections of the course, will be the site of the CIAC class meets on Saturday, October 31, and the State Open on November 6. The Invitational helped those Rams who have state tournament experience get reacquainted with the course, and gave the newer runners a first look at the layout. 
Following St. George and Urbahn was senior Aidan Buck, who clocked in at 18:26 and took 57th place. 
Sophomore Henry Asker finished 97th in 18:56, and senior Ryan McGough finished 115th in 19:08 to round out New Canaan’s scoring. 
Junior Jake Grigsby was 130th in 19:17, and senior Patrick Blasco was 210th in 19:55. 
The unseeded varsity race featured 486 runners representing 70 schools. 
The Rams scored 284 points to finish third in the team standings, with Shepaug Valley first (148), Barlow second (263), East Catholic fourth (315), and Rocky Hill fifth (348). 
In the junior varsity race, New Canaan scored 94 points to finish fourth behind Amity (50), Hall (68), and Nashua North, N.H., (89), with Middletown (175) in fifth place. 
Junior Fausto Cortina led the Rams with a sixth-place finish in 18:51. He was followed by junior Jack O’Connor in 16th in 19:08, sophomore Alex Orwicz in 17th in 19:08, and senior Chris Roman in 18th in 19:18. 
Junior Tim Russo finished New Canaan’s scoring by taking 39th place in 19:50, with sophomores Noah Levine 43rd (19:53) and Dylan Wietfeldt 50th (20:01). 
The Rams will host their final regular-season meet on Tuesday at 4 p.m. in Waveny Park, which will be the site of the FCIAC championship on Wednesday, Oct. 21. New Canaan senior Aidan Buck races up a hill during a cross country meet in Waveny Park this season. — Dave Stewart photo
